pull.title: Remove unused fScriptChecks parameter from CheckInputs
pull.body:
fScriptChecks = false just short-circuits the entire function, so
passing it in is entirely useless.

This is extracted from #13233 /cc TheBlueMatt.

Recommend reviewing with `git show --ignore-all-space`, i.e.:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13868/files?w=1

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16658](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16658.html) ([WIP] validation: Rename CheckInputs to CheckInputScripts by jnewbery)
* [#16486](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16486.html) ([consensus] skip bip30 checks when assumevalid is set for the block by pstratem)
* [#13204](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/13204.html) (Faster sigcache nonce by JeremyRubin)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: validation: Document where we are intentionally ignoring bool return values from validation related functions
issue.body:
* Document where we are intentionally ignoring the return value from `bool` returning functions from `validation.{cpp,h}` that modify state
* Mark validation functions whose `bool` return value should not be discarded in the general case with `NODISCARD` (expands to `[[nodiscard]]` or `__attribute__((warn_unused_result))` depending on availability)

This will help us identify code where we're we incorrectly assume that a certain function always succeeds in performing its state modification.

issue.title: policy: Remove promiscuousmempoolflags
issue.body: It seems odd to clutter validation code with features that can only ever be used for testing (testnet or regtest). Removing that test-only code makes the mempool logic less painful to understand and easier to reason about when changed or refactored in the future.

issue.title: Minor style enhancement in documentation
issue.body:
It is considered a best practice to avoid noun+verb contractions in technical documentation as it makes it easier to read, especially for non native English speakers.
As a reference: https://developers.google.com/style/contractions

issue.title: refactor: Make explicit CMutableTransaction -> CTransaction conversion.
issue.body:
This PR makes explicit the now implicit conversion constructor `CTransaction(const CMutableTransaction&)` in `transaction.h`. 
Minimal changes were made elsewhere to make the code compilable. I'll follow up with other PRs to address individually refactoring functions that should have a `CMutableTransaction` version, or where a `CTransaction` should be reused. 

The rationale for this change is:

 - Conversion constructors should not be explicit unless there's a strong reason for it (in the opinion of, for example, https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html, and https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#Ro-conversion. Let me know your take on this).
 - This particular conversion is very costly -- it implies a serialization plus hash of the transaction.
 - Even though `CTransaction` and `CMutableTransaction` represent the same data, they have very different use cases and performance properties.
 - Making it explicit allows for easier reasoning of performance trade-offs.
 - There has been previous performance issues caused by unneeded use of this implicit conversion.
 - This PR creates a map for places to look for possible refactoring and performance gains (this benefit still holds if the PR is not merged).

issue.title: Faster sigcache nonce
issue.body:
This PR replaces nonces in two places with pre-salted hashers.

The nonce is chosen to be 64 bytes long so that it forces the SHA256 hasher to process the chunk. This leaves the next 64 (or 56 depending if final chunk) open for data. In the case of the script execution cache, this does not make a big performance improvement because the nonce was already properly padded to fit into one buffer, but does make the code a little simpler. In the case of the sig cache, this should reduce the hashing overhead slightly because we are less likely to need an additional processing step.

I haven't benchmarked this, but back of the envelope it should reduce the hashing by one buffer for all combinations except compressed public keys with compact signatures.

issue.title: Remove redundant run time assertions for locks already checked at compile time
issue.body:
Remove redundant run time assertions (`AssertLockHeld(foo)`) for locks already checked at compile time (`EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(foo)`, `-Wthread-safety`).

The redundancy can be verified by checking that the function that contains the removed run time assertion has the corresponding compile time check.

The relevant compile time checks can be listed using:

```
git grep -E -A3 '(ImplicitlyLearnRelatedKeyScripts|MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs|TipMayBeStale|BlockRequestAllowed|SendRejectsAndCheckIfBanned|ConsiderEviction|IsRBFOptIn|entryToJSON|removeForReorg|GetSortedDepthAndScore|RemoveStaged|trackPackageRemoved|CheckFinalTx|TestLockPointValidity|IsCurrentForFeeEstimation|UpdateMempoolForReorg|CheckInputsFromMempoolAndCache|AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker|CheckForkWarningConditions|CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork|CheckInputs|GetBlockScriptFlags|ConnectBlock|ActivateBestChainStep|InvalidateBlock|ResetBlockFailureFlags|AddToBlockIndex|AcceptBlockHeader|AcceptBlock|TestBlockValidity|InsertBlockIndex|GenerateNewKey|AddKeyPubKeyWithDB|LoadKeyMetadata|LoadScriptMetadata|UpdateTimeFirstKey|RemoveWatchOnly|HasWalletSpend|IncOrderPosNext|AvailableCoins|ListCoins|SignTransaction|ZapSelectTx|KeypoolCountExternalKeys|LoadKeyPool|GetAddressGroupings|MarkReserveKeysAsUsed|LockCoin|UnlockCoin|UnlockAllCoins|IsLockedCoin|ListLockedCoins)' | grep -B3 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED
```

issue.title: test: Add linter to make sure single parameter constructors are marked explicit
issue.body:
Make single parameter constructors `explicit` (C++11).

Rationale from the developer notes:

> - By default, declare single-argument constructors `explicit`.
>   - *Rationale*: This is a precaution to avoid unintended conversions that might
>   arise when single-argument constructors are used as implicit conversion
>   functions.

issue.title: validation: Rename CheckInputs to CheckInputScripts
issue.body:
CheckInputs() used to check no double spends, scripts & sigs and amounts. Since
832e074, the double spend and amount checks
have been moved to CheckTxInputs(), and CheckInputs() now just validates
input scripts. Rename the function to CheckInputScripts().

Also fix incorrect comments.

events.body: @TheBlueMatt @BugTheBlueMatt want to take a look here given it's your change.
Concept ACK.

events.message:
Remove unused fScriptChecks parameter from CheckInputs

fScriptChecks = false just short-circuits the entire function, so
passing it in is entirely useless.

events.body: @TheBlueMatt thanks for pointing that out. Comment moved to `AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker`.
utACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1. Checked diff had no functional change and new comment copy looks correct.

ACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1 - Notes / testing below.

[CheckInputs()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/validation.cpp#L1301) is called from:

1. [CheckInputsFromMempoolAndCache()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/validation.cpp#L397) - fScriptChecks was true
2. [AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/validation.cpp#L438) - 3 times and  fScriptChecks was always true
3. [CChainState::ConnectBlock()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/validation.cpp#L1714) -  fScriptChecks is true unless

   1. we have an assumeValid hash and
   2. [GetBlockProofEquivalentTime()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/chain.cpp#L137) is <= 1209600 seconds ( 2 weeks)

Changes to `CheckInputs()`:
1. Drop the `fScriptChecks` parameter.
2. `IsCoinBase()` check is now clearer. i.e
```cpp
if (!tx.IsCoinBase()) {
    // do input checking
}
return true
```
is now:
```cpp
if (tx.IsCoinBase()) return true;
// do input checking
return true
```
3. Brackets around the `pvChecks` check.
4. Moved the "The first loop above does.." comment to `AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker`.
5. Moved "Skip script verification.." to `ConnectBlock`.

Added some logging and tested:
* Given a garbage `-assumevalid=garbage` hash fScriptChecks was true (early IBD).
* Modified CheckInputs() to return false - checked that we drop into the ConnectBlock error.
* Modified CheckInputs() to return false and ran with `-assumevalid=garbage` - checked that we drop into the ConnectBlock error.

Other thought. It looks like everywhere we call `CheckInputs()` we are already checking prior that the tx is not a coinbase. Although I cannot see a downside to a belt-and-suspenders check inside `CheckInputs()`.

@jnewbery can you re-review here?

ACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1

Verified that function does essentially nothing if the flag is false.

ACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1 ; code review, checked tests work. Looks right to me, and fanquake's notes make sense. Could change the coinbase early exit to `assert(!tx.IsCoinBase());`.
Posthumous ACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1
post-merge ACK 9b92538adebd30353ffc1a427bc20ab0c3fc75f1 with one comment nit.

comments.body: nit: since you re-indent the whole function body you might also remove this scope and put a `if (tx.IsCoinBase()) return true;` in the first line.
I mean if you're gonna fix things, also remove this comment (or move it to ATMP, where it belongs).

This is a really confusing comment here. "The first loop" refers to the checks inside `CheckTxInputs()` call on L566, which has been moved around since the comment was first written.

I'll fix this comment in a follow-up PR.
